poem:
**Anticipated Frames**

The paper whispers of dreams,  
sinewed stories in ink.  
A muscle-clad star, once poised  
on the brink of gleaming honors,  
now encircled by shadows.  
Cinematic sizzle reels—  
dissolved to a distant echo,  
yet in each specter's reflection,  
a fable of ambition tangled,  
etched beneath skin and spotlight's glow.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Magazine Dreams review – powerful bodybuilding drama dogged by star Jonathan Majors’ assault conviction Back in 2023, rising star Jonathan Majors was swinging for the fences and beyond in this colossal, Paul Schrader-esque psychodrama about a would-be bodybuilder, for which role Majors got himself stacked to beast proportions. Many expected it to play a huge part in the awards conversation, with key scenes surely destined to be shown in sizzle reel clips at endless prize". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Magazine Dreams review – powerful bodybuilding drama dogged by star Jonathan Majors’ assault conviction Back in 2023, rising star Jonathan Majors was swinging for the fences and beyond in this colossal, Paul Schrader-esque psychodrama about a would-be bodybuilder, for which role Majors got himself stacked to beast proportions. Many expected it to play a huge part in the awards conversation, with key scenes surely destined to be shown in sizzle reel clips at endless prize
